title.value: An enhanced wideband tracking method for characteristic modes
title.justification: The paper's title clearly states the focus on an enhanced method for tracking characteristic modes across a wideband spectrum.
title.quote: Huang C, Guo C, Ma X, Yuan Y, Ding J (2024). An enhanced wideband tracking method for characteristic modes.

extractions.description: This paper proposes a new multi-stage method to track characteristic modes across a wide frequency range. By enhancing classical eigenvector correlation-based algorithms, it addresses issues like mode swapping and CRA errors, improves computational efficiency, and ensures accurate tracking even with complex structures.

type.justification: The paper presents a method and verifies its efficacy through numerical examples and performance comparisons, indicative of empirical research.
type.quote: To demonstrate its effectiveness, CMs of a conductor plate and a fractal structure are examined using the proposed method.

name.justification: The research deals with characteristic modes, eigenvalue problems, and related algorithms in the context of electromagnetic applications, such as antenna design.
name.quote: The theory of characteristic mode (TCM)... has received much attention in recent years for its wide application in the electromagnetic field, particularly in antenna design.

name.justification: The study focuses on methods applied to improve electromagnetic analysis, specifically in the context of antenna design.
The paper involves solving eigenvalue problems using computational methods like MoM and discusses enhancements for efficiency and accuracy in electromagnetic simulations.
name.quote: In the TCM, the radiating and scattering proprieties... are intuitively obtained by solving a frequency domain generalized eigenvalue equation (GEE) defined by the method-of-moments (MoM) impedance matrix.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses the ECBA as a model for tracking characteristic modes and also compares enhancements to the classical ECBA.
name.quote: Over the past decade, many efforts have been devoted to achieving modal tracking, predominantly relying on correlation-based algorithms with varied qualities, including eigenvalue [7], eigenvector [8], surface current [9], and far-field [10]. Among these, the eigenvector correlation-based algorithm (ECBA) is the most popular...

is_contributed.justification: The ECBA is discussed as a classical approach that the paper enhances, rather than being a new contribution of the paper itself.
is_contributed.quote: As a classical approach, the ECBA in paper [11] mitigates the mode swapping by introducing an arbitration stage.

is_executed.justification: The ECBA is executed within the scope of the study to demonstrate the performance of the proposed enhancements.
is_executed.quote: In comparison with other reported ECBA tracking methods, the proposed one introduces several novelties as follows:

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the enhanced ECBA to other reported ECBA tracking methods to highlight improvements in performance and efficiency.
is_compared.quote: In comparison with other reported ECBA tracking methods...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper is cited as a classical example of ECBA applied in wideband characteristic mode tracking.
referenced_paper_title.quote: As a classical approach, the ECBA in paper [11] mitigates the mode swapping by introducing an arbitration stage.

name.justification: MATLAB R2022b is used to perform numerical simulations throughout the study.
name.quote: All numerical simulations are performed using MATLAB R2022b, employing double precision...

referenced_paper_title.justification: While not referenced in a specific paper, MATLAB is a well-cited tool for numerical analysis and simulation as mentioned in the context of use in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All numerical simulations are performed using MATLAB R2022b, employing double precision on a desktop computer.
